page.title: 04 MINERS' STRIKE 1984-85
page.content: Most of the nation's{coalminers}were on strike for nearly a year to try to stop pit closures. We asked some people in {Askern}how the strike had affected them. Most people who we interviewed said that they wanted the strike to end. They wanted the strike to end because they had no money and no coal. Four out of fourteen said that they had made more friends and one person said that he had made more friends but had lost a few as well. A lot of people were affected by the strike because they had no money to go out or pay bills, buy sweets or biscuits. One person who did not want the{miners' {strike}to end said that they should stop on to get a better deal, but he was not a miner and he was not affected as much as the miners.
